events.name: US promises South Korea more insight into nuclear planning
events.wd_label: US promises South Korea more insight into nuclear planning
events.wd_description: The United States has promised South Korea more insight into its nuclear planning over any conflict with North Korea.
events.description: The United States has promised South Korea more insight into its nuclear planning over any conflict with North Korea.

events.name: US-South Korea talks
events.wd_description: The announcement followed talks between US President Joe Biden and South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol, discussing North Korea, semiconductor chips, trade, and the war in Ukraine.
events.description: The announcement followed talks between US President Joe Biden and South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol, discussing North Korea, semiconductor chips, trade, and the war in Ukraine.

events.name: South Korea's commitment
events.wd_description: The deal includes South Korea's commitment not to pursue a nuclear bomb.
events.description: The deal includes South Korea's commitment not to pursue a nuclear bomb.

events.name: Bilateral consultations
events.wd_description: In the event of North Korea's nuclear attack, the US and South Korea have agreed to immediate bilateral presidential consultations and promised a swift, overwhelming, and decisive response, including the use of US nuclear weapons.
events.description: In the event of North Korea's nuclear attack, the US and South Korea have agreed to immediate bilateral presidential consultations and promised a swift, overwhelming, and decisive response, including the use of US nuclear weapons.

events.name: Japan to develop long-range missiles
events.wd_description: Japan announced plans to develop long-range missiles due to increased tension with China. The Ministry of Defense signed contracts with Mitsubishi Heavy Industries (MHI) for the development and mass production of these weapons.
events.description: Japan announced plans to develop long-range missiles due to increased tension with China. The Ministry of Defense signed contracts with Mitsubishi Heavy Industries (MHI) for the development and mass production of these weapons.

events.name: Contract details
events.wd_description: The Ministry of Defense in Japan signed contracts with MHI worth more than $2.8 billion for a development and production plan extending to 2027.
events.description: The Ministry of Defense in Japan signed contracts with MHI worth more than $2.8 billion for a development and production plan extending to 2027.

events.name: Mass production of missiles
events.wd_description: MHI will begin mass production of two types of missiles this year: ground-launched Type 12 guided missiles for targeting ships and hypersonic glide missiles for island defense.
events.description: MHI will begin mass production of two types of missiles this year: ground-launched Type 12 guided missiles for targeting ships and hypersonic glide missiles for island defense.

events.name: Development of submarine-launched missiles
events.wd_description: MHI is expected to begin developing submarine-launched missiles for the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force's fleet of conventionally powered boats.
events.description: MHI is expected to begin developing submarine-launched missiles for the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force's fleet of conventionally powered boats.

events.name: Italy blocks Chinese company from taking over Pirelli
events.wd_label: Italy blocks Chinese company from taking over Pirelli
events.wd_description: Italy has moved to block a Chinese state-owned company from taking over Pirelli, a renowned tire-making industry, as part of measures to protect Pirelli's independence.
events.description: Italy has moved to block a Chinese state-owned company from taking over Pirelli, a renowned tire-making industry, as part of measures to protect Pirelli's independence.

events.name: Italian government ruling
events.wd_description: The Italian government ruled that only Camfin, a company controlled by Pirelli’s boss Marco Tronchetti Provera, has the authority to nominate candidates for its chief executive.
events.description: The Italian government ruled that only Camfin, a company controlled by Pirelli’s boss Marco Tronchetti Provera, has the authority to nominate candidates for its chief executive.

events.name: Examination under Golden Power Procedure
events.wd_description: The agreement was examined by the administration of the Italian Prime Minister under the Golden Power Procedure rules, which aim to protect businesses deemed strategically important to the nation.
events.description: The agreement was examined by the administration of the Italian Prime Minister under the Golden Power Procedure rules, which aim to protect businesses deemed strategically important to the nation.

events.name: Pirelli's ownership history
events.wd_description: Pirelli was sold for €7.1bn ($7.8bn) in 2015 to a group of investors, including ChemChina and Camfin. ChemChina later merged with state-owned Sinochem.
events.description: Pirelli was sold for €7.1bn ($7.8bn) in 2015 to a group of investors, including ChemChina and Camfin. ChemChina later merged with state-owned Sinochem.

events.name: Shanghai Auto Show 2023
events.wd_description: The Shanghai Auto Show is opening after being canceled last year due to China's zero-COVID curbs, featuring numerous Chinese and foreign automakers unveiling their latest models and technologies, especially EVs.
events.description: The Shanghai Auto Show is opening after being canceled last year due to China's zero-COVID curbs, featuring numerous Chinese and foreign automakers unveiling their latest models and technologies, especially EVs.

events.name: Chinese automakers
events.wd_description: Chinese firms like BYD, Geely, and Nio are displaying a range of electric vehicles to strengthen their position in the world's largest auto and EV market.
events.description: Chinese firms like BYD, Geely, and Nio are displaying a range of electric vehicles to strengthen their position in the world's largest auto and EV market.

events.name: Global EV trends
events.wd_description: EVs are becoming central in the global auto scene due to ambitious e-mobility plans and government support amid climate change concerns.
events.description: EVs are becoming central in the global auto scene due to ambitious e-mobility plans and government support amid climate change concerns.

events.name: US EV policy
events.wd_description: The Biden administration proposes new rules to cut pollution from automobiles, requiring up to two-thirds of new vehicles sold in the US to be electric by 2032.
events.description: The Biden administration proposes new rules to cut pollution from automobiles, requiring up to two-thirds of new vehicles sold in the US to be electric by 2032.

events.name: EU EV policy
events.wd_description: The EU aims to speed up the switch to EVs by effectively banning the sale of new petrol and diesel cars from 2035.
events.description: The EU aims to speed up the switch to EVs by effectively banning the sale of new petrol and diesel cars from 2035.

events.name: Investment in EVs and batteries
events.wd_description: The world's top automakers plan to invest nearly $1.2 trillion in EVs and batteries through 2030, with battery-powered cars' share in total auto sales projected to rise significantly.
events.description: The world's top automakers plan to invest nearly $1.2 trillion in EVs and batteries through 2030, with battery-powered cars' share in total auto sales projected to rise significantly.

events.name: Demand for EV batteries
events.wd_description: The surge in demand for EV batteries is prompting governments and companies to secure adequate supplies, with China leading in battery tech and production.
events.description: The surge in demand for EV batteries is prompting governments and companies to secure adequate supplies, with China leading in battery tech and production.

events.name: China's dominance in battery tech
events.wd_description: China accounts for almost 75% of global battery manufacturing capacity, controlling various stages of the supply chain from mining to final assembly.
events.description: China accounts for almost 75% of global battery manufacturing capacity, controlling various stages of the supply chain from mining to final assembly.

events.name: US reliance on Chinese batteries
events.wd_description: Many Western automakers like Tesla and General Motors rely on Chinese firms like CATL for their battery needs, despite geopolitical tensions.
events.description: Many Western automakers like Tesla and General Motors rely on Chinese firms like CATL for their battery needs, despite geopolitical tensions.

events.name: US policy on EV battery supply
events.wd_label: US policy on EV battery supply
events.wd_description: The Inflation Reduction Act aims to reduce reliance on Chinese battery cells by providing subsidies and tax breaks for US-made EVs and batteries.
events.description: The Inflation Reduction Act aims to reduce reliance on Chinese battery cells by providing subsidies and tax breaks for US-made EVs and batteries.

events.name: EU battery industry
events.wd_description: The EU has been pushing for a domestic EV battery industry, with the European Battery Alliance launched in 2017 to meet the region's battery needs by 2030.
events.description: The EU has been pushing for a domestic EV battery industry, with the European Battery Alliance launched in 2017 to meet the region's battery needs by 2030.

events.name: EU investment in battery production
events.wd_description: European companies like Volkswagen are investing in mines and battery plants to secure raw materials and scale up production.
events.description: European companies like Volkswagen are investing in mines and battery plants to secure raw materials and scale up production.

events.name: Future of EV battery industry
events.wd_description: The EV battery industry is in flux, with European firms having an opportunity to catch up by focusing on new technologies like solid-state batteries.
events.description: The EV battery industry is in flux, with European firms having an opportunity to catch up by focusing on new technologies like solid-state batteries.
